001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
004
005import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.polynomials.PolynomialFunction;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.solvers.NewtonRaphsonSolver;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.solvers.UnivariateDifferentiableSolver;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
011
012import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015
016/**
017 * A camera model with parameters as specified in Zhang's paper.
018 * @author WB
019 */
020public class Camera {
021        
022        /**  
023         * The camera's inner transformation matrix:
024         * | alpha  gamma  uc |
025         * |     0   beta  vc |
026         */
027        private final double[][] A;     // 2 x 3
028        private final double[] K;       // the vector of lens distortion coefficients
029                
030        // for the standard Zhang camera
031        public Camera(double alpha, double beta, double gamma, double uc, double vc, double k0, double k1) {
032                this.A = makeA(alpha, beta, gamma, uc, vc);
033                this.K = new double[] {k0, k1};
034        }
035        
036        /**
037         * Creates a standard camera from a vector of intrinsic parameters 
038         * @param s a vector of intrinsic camera parameters (alpha, beta, gamma, uc, vc, k0, k1).
039         */
040        public Camera (double[] s) {
041                //s = (alpha, beta, gamma, uc, vc, k0, k1);     
042                this.A = makeA(s[0], s[1], s[2], s[3], s[4]);
043                this.K = new double[] {s[5], s[6]};
044        }
045                
046        /**
047         * Creates a standard camera from a transformation matrix and a vector
048         * of lens distortion coefficients.
049         * @param A the (min.) 2 x 3 matrix holding the intrinsic camera parameters
050         * @param K the radial distortion coefficients k0, k1, ... (may be {@code null})
051         */
052        public Camera(RealMatrix A, double[] K) {
053                this.K = (K == null) ? new double[0] : K.clone();
054                this.A = A.getSubMatrix(0, 1, 0, 2).getData();
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Creates a simple pinhole camera (with no distortion whatsoever).
059         * @param f the camera's focal length (in pixel units).
060         * @param uc the x-position of the optical axis intersecting the image plane (in pixel units)
061         * @param vc the y-position of the optical axis intersecting the image plane (in pixel units)
062         */
063        public Camera(double f, double uc, double vc) {
064                this.K = new double[0];
065                this.A = makeA(f, f, 0, uc, vc);
066        }
067        
068        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070        private double[][] makeA(double alpha, double beta, double gamma, double uc, double vc) {
071                return new double[][] {
072                                {alpha, gamma, uc},
073                                {    0,  beta, vc}};
074        }
075        
076        // P is assumed to be a X/Y point in the Z = 0 plane
077        /**
078         * Projects the X/Y world point (in the Z = 0 plane)
079         * to image coordinates under the given camera view (extrinsic transformation parameters).
080         * @param view the extrinsic transformation parameters
081         * @param P a single X/Y world point (with Z = 0)
082         * @return the projected 2D image coordinates
083         */
084        public double[] project(ViewTransform view, Point2D P) {
085                double[] XY0 = new double[] {P.getX(), P.getY(), 0}; 
086                return this.project(view, XY0);
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Projects the X/Y world points (all in the Z = 0 plane)
091         * to image coordinates under the given camera view (extrinsic transformation parameters).
092         * @param view the extrinsic transformation parameters
093         * @param PP a set of X/Y world points (with Z = 0)
094         * @return the projected 2D image coordinates
095         */
096        public Point2D[] project(ViewTransform view, Point2D[] PP) {
097                Point2D[] imagePoints = new Point2D[PP.length];
098                for (int j = 0; j < PP.length; j++) {
099                        double[] uv = project(view, PP[j]);
100                        imagePoints[j] = MathUtil.toPoint2D(uv);
101                }
102                return imagePoints;
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Projects the given 3D point onto the sensor plane of this camera
107         * for the provided extrinsic view parameters.
108         * 
109         * @param view the extrinsic camera (view) parameters
110         * @param XYZ a point in 3D world coordinates
111         * @return the 2D sensor coordinates of the projected point
112         */
113        public double[] project(ViewTransform view, double[] XYZ) {
114                // map to the ideal projection plane (f = 1)
115                double[] xy = projectNormalized(view, XYZ);
116                // apply radial lens distortion to the ideal projection
117                double[] xyd = warp(xy);
118                // apply the intrinsic camera transformation:
119                double[] uv = mapToSensorPlane(xyd);
120                return uv;
121        }
122        
123        
124        /**
125         * Projects the given 3D point to ideal projection coordinates
126         * for the provided extrinsic view parameters. The world point is
127         * specified as a 2D coordinate in the Z = 0 plane.
128         * 
129         * @param view the extrinsic camera (view) parameters
130         * @param P a point in 3D world coordinates (Z = 0)
131         * @return the 2D ideal projection
132         */
133        public double[] projectNormalized(ViewTransform view, Point2D P) {
134                double[] XY0 = {P.getX(), P.getY(), 0};
135                return projectNormalized(view, XY0);
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * Projects the given 3D point to ideal projection coordinates
140         * for the provided extrinsic view parameters.
141         * 
142         * @param view the extrinsic camera (view) parameters
143         * @param XYZ a point in 3D world coordinates
144         * @return the 2D ideal projection
145         */
146        public double[] projectNormalized(ViewTransform view, double[] XYZ) {
147                double[] XYZc = view.applyTo(XYZ);
148                // Compute normalized projection coordinates (f = 1):
149                final double x = XYZc[0] / XYZc[2];
150                final double y = XYZc[1] / XYZc[2];
151                return new double[] {x, y};
152        }
153        
154        // not used in this form, just for symmetry
155        private double warp(double r) {
156                return r * (1 + D(r));
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Applies radial distortion to a point in the ideal 2D projection.
161         * @param xy a 2D point in the ideal projection
162         * @return the lens-distorted position in the ideal projection
163         */
164        public double[] warp(double[] xy) {
165                final double x = xy[0];
166                final double y = xy[1];
167                final double r = Math.sqrt(x * x + y * y);
168                double d = (1 + D(r));
169                return new double[] {d * x, d * y};
170        }
171        
172        /**
173         * Inverse radial distortion function. Finds the original
174         * (undistorted) radius r from the distorted radius R, both
175         * measured from the center = (0,0) of the ideal projection.
176         * Finds r as the root of the polynomial
177         * p(r) = - R + r + k0 * r^3 + k1 * r^5,
178         * where R is constant, by using a Newton-Raphson solver.
179         * @param R the distorted radius
180         * @return the undistorted radius
181         */
182        public double unwarp(double R) {
183                double k0 = K[0];
184                double k1 = K[1];
185                double[] coefficients = {-R, 1, 0, k0, 0, k1};
186                PolynomialFunction p = new PolynomialFunction(coefficients);
187                UnivariateDifferentiableSolver solver = new NewtonRaphsonSolver();
188                double rInit = R;
189                int maxEval = 20;
190                double r = solver.solve(maxEval, p, rInit);
191//              System.out.format("** solver iterations = %d\n", solver.getEvaluations());
192                return r;
193        }
194        
195        /**
196         * Applies inverse radial distortion to a given point in the ideal image plane.
197         * @param xyd a distorted 2D point in the ideal image plane
198         * @return the undistorted point
199         */
200        public double[] unwarp(double[] xyd) {
201                final double xd = xyd[0];
202                final double yd = xyd[1];
203                final double R = Math.sqrt(xd * xd + yd * yd);  // distorted radius
204                final double r = unwarp(R);                                             // undistorted radius
205                final double s = r / R;
206                return new double[] {s * xd, s * yd};
207        }
208        
209
210        /**
211         * Radial distortion function, to be applied in the form r' = r * (1 + D(r))
212         * to points in the ideal projection plane.
213         * Distortion coefficients k0, k1 are a property of the enclosing {@link Camera}.
214         * @param r the original radius of a point in the ideal projection plane
215         * @return the pos/neg deviation for the given radius
216         */
217        public double D(double r) {
218                final double k0 = (K.length > 0) ? K[0] : 0;
219                final double k1 = (K.length > 1) ? K[1] : 0;
220                final double r2 = r * r;
221                return (k0 + k1 * r2) * r2;             // D(r) = k0 * r^2 + k1 * r^4
222        }
223        
224        
225        /**
226         * Maps from the ideal projection plane to sensor coordinates,
227         * using the camera's intrinsic parameters.
228         * @param xyd a 2D point on the ideal projection plane
229         * @return the resulting 2D sensor coordinate
230         */
231        public double[] mapToSensorPlane(double[] xyd) {
232                final double x = xyd[0];
233                final double y = xyd[1];
234                final double u = A[0][0] * x + A[0][1] * y + A[0][2];
235                final double v =               A[1][1] * y + A[1][2];
236                return new double[] {u, v};     
237        }
238        
239        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
240        
241        /**
242         * Returns the camera's inner parameters as a vector 
243         * (alpha, beta, gamma, uc, vc, k0, k1).
244         * @return the camera's inner parameters
245         */
246        public double[] getParameterVector() {
247                return new double[] 
248                                {getAlpha(), getBeta(), getGamma(), getUc(), getVc(), K[0], K[1]};      
249        }
250
251        /**
252         * Returns the camera's alpha value.
253         * @return alpha
254         */
255        public double getAlpha() {
256                return A[0][0];
257        }
258
259        /**
260         * Returns the camera's beta value.
261         * @return beta
262         */
263        public double getBeta() {
264                return A[1][1];
265        }
266
267        /**
268         * Returns the camera's gamma value.
269         * @return gamma
270         */
271        public double getGamma() {
272                return A[0][1];
273        }
274
275        /**
276         * Returns the camera's uc value.
277         * @return uc
278         */
279        public double getUc() {
280                return A[0][2];
281        }
282
283        /**
284         * Returns the camera's vc value.
285         * @return vc
286         */
287        public double getVc() {
288                return A[1][2];
289        }
290
291        /**
292         * Returns the camera's lens distortion coefficients.
293         * @return the vector of lens distortion coefficients
294         */
295        public double[] getK() {
296                return K;
297        }
298        
299        /**
300         * Returns a copy of the camera's inner transformation matrix with contents
301         * <pre> 
302         *    alpha  gamma  uc
303         *        0   beta  vc 
304         * </pre>
305         * 
306         * @return the camara's inner transformation matrix (2 x 3)
307         */
308        public RealMatrix getA() {
309                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
310        }
311        
312        
313        /**
314         * Returns the inverse of the camera intrinsic matrix A
315         * as a 3x3 matrix (without the last row {0,0,1}).
316         * This version uses closed form matrix inversion.
317         * Used for rectifying images (i.e., removing lens distortion).
318         * 
319         * @return the inverse of the camera intrinsic matrix A
320         */
321        public RealMatrix getInverseA() {
322                double alpha = A[0][0];
323                double beta = A[1][1];
324                double gamma = A[0][1];
325                double uc = A[0][2];
326                double vc = A[1][2];
327                double[][] Ai = {
328                        {1.0/alpha, -gamma/(alpha*beta), (gamma*vc - beta*uc)/(alpha*beta)},
329                        {0,         1.0/beta,            -vc/beta}};
330                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Ai);
331        }
332        
333        /**
334         * Returns the homography for the given view as a 3 x 3 matrix.
335         * @param view the extrinsic view parameters
336         * @return the homography matrix
337         */
338        public RealMatrix getHomography(ViewTransform view) {
339                RealMatrix RT = view.getRotationMatrix();
340                RealVector T = view.getTranslationVector();
341                RT.setColumnVector(2, T);
342                
343                RealMatrix AM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3); 
344                AM.setSubMatrix(A, 0, 0);
345                AM.setEntry(2, 2, 1);
346                
347                RealMatrix H = AM.multiply(RT); 
348                return H.scalarMultiply(1.0 / H.getEntry(2, 2));
349        }
350        
351        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
352        
353        @Deprecated
354        public void print(String title) {
355                System.out.println(this.toString());
356        }
357        
358        @Override
359        public String toString() {
360                return String.format("alpha=%.4f, beta=%.4f, gamma=%.4f, uc=%.4f, vc=%.4f, K=%s",
361                                getAlpha(), getBeta(), getGamma(), getUc(), getVc(), Matrix.toString(getK()));
362        }
363        
364        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
365        
366        /**
367         * Used for testing only.
368         * @param args ignored
369         */
370        public static void main(String[] args) {
371                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform();
372                
373                System.out.println("Camera 1:");
374                Camera camera1 = new Camera (
375                                832.5, 832.53, 0.204494,        // alpha, beta, gamma, 
376                                303.959, 206.585,                       // c_x, c_y
377                                -0.228601, 0.190353);           // k0, k1
378                System.out.format("k0=%.4f, k1=%.4f\n", camera1.getK()[0], camera1.getK()[1]);
379                double[] XYZ1 = {40, 70, 800};
380                double[] uv1 = camera1.project(view, XYZ1);
381                System.out.print(Matrix.toString(XYZ1) + " -> ");
382                System.out.format("u=%.4f, u=%.4f\n", uv1[0], uv1[1]);
383                
384                double r = 0.95;
385                double rr = camera1.warp(r);
386                System.out.format("radial distortion: r=%.4f -> rr=%.4f\n", r, rr);
387                r = camera1.unwarp(rr);
388                System.out.format("inv. radial distortion: rr=%.4f -> r=%.4f\n", rr, r);
389                
390                System.out.println();
391                
392                // distorted camera
393                System.out.println("Camera 2:");
394                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
395                                {832.5, 0.204494, 303.959},
396                                {  0.0, 832.53, 206.585},
397                                {  0.0,   0.0,     1.0}});
398                Camera camera2 = new Camera(A, new double[] {-0.2, 0.190353});
399                System.out.format("k0=%.4f, k1=%.4f\n", camera2.getK()[0], camera2.getK()[1]);
400                
401                double[] XYZ2 = {40, 70, 800};
402                double[] uv2 = camera2.project(view, XYZ2);
403                System.out.print(Matrix.toString(XYZ2) + " -> ");
404                System.out.format("u=%.4f, u=%.4f\n", uv2[0], uv2[1]);
405                
406                r = 0.95;
407                rr = camera2.warp(r);
408                System.out.format("radial distortion: r=%.4f -> rr=%.4f\n", r, rr);
409                r = camera2.unwarp(rr);
410                System.out.format("inv. radial distortion: rr=%.4f -> r=%.4f\n", rr, r);
411                
412                System.out.println("\nTesting radial lens distortion:");
413                double[] xy2 = {0.3, -0.7};
414                System.out.format("original x=%.4f, y=%.4f\n", xy2[0], xy2[1]);
415                double[] xy2d = camera2.warp(xy2);
416                System.out.format("distorted x=%.4f, y=%.4f\n", xy2d[0], xy2d[1]);
417                double[] xy2u = camera2.unwarp(xy2d);
418                System.out.format("undistorted x=%.4f, y=%.4f\n", xy2u[0], xy2u[1]);
419                
420                System.out.println("\nTesting only radial lens distortion fun:");
421                double ra = 0.10;
422                double rb = camera2.warp(ra);
423                double rc = camera2.unwarp(rb);
424                System.out.format("ra=%.4f, rb=%.4f, rc=%.4f\n", ra, rb, rc);
425        }
426        
427}
